intro: Alafia barteri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15-30 cm and prefers bright, indirect light. Its roots are fibrous, and it is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. Alafia barteri is known for its ability to thrive in humid environments with well-draining soil.
